forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 55. West southwest wind 13 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 13 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this evening, the atmosphere settles into a cocoon of soft clouds as twilight approaches. A slight drizzle may tease the city after 11 PM, but the chances remain modest, lingering faintly at twenty percent. The air is cool, wrapping around on a gentle breeze from the west, with whispers of wind that dance through the streets, offering a lively touch to the otherwise subdued air. Looking out towards the Golden Gate, you might spot the outlines of the iconic bridge shrouded, hinting at the marine layer's presence, a nostalgic embrace of fog that the city wears with pride.

As night draws near, temperatures will hover comfortably around 55 degrees, a gentle reminder to bring a light jacket or a cozy sweater if you plan to navigate the avenues after dark. The weather holds promise for Sunday—a slight chance of morning drizzle gives way to a more cheerful forecast of sunshine, inviting those with a penchant for leisurely strolls or relaxed brunches to savor the warmth of the late morning. There’s a gentle push toward outdoor adventures, as mild breezes suggest biking along the waterfront or wandering through Golden Gate Park. In short, as the evening unfurls, it invites you to bask in the soft glow of city lights, cloaked in the hopeful anticipation that tomorrow will bring a touch more brightness to the Bay Area skyline.
